note.title: Cybersecurity
note.content:
### Why Cybersecurity?
Iâ€™ve always been drawn to understanding how systems break â€” and how to protect them. Cybersecurity combines technology, psychology, and strategy â€” itâ€™s not just about defending systems, but about understanding how attackers think. 

 I became deeply interested in cybersecurity after joining Toyota Canadaâ€™s Information Security team, where I worked on everything from risk assessments to security awareness. 

### ğŸ” My Experience with Cybersecurity
 Hereâ€™s where Iâ€™ve built hands-on cybersecurity knowledge and skills: 

- Toyota Canada Inc. (Information Security Intern) (2024)
- [[CompTIA Security+]] (2025)
- [[Google Cybersecurity Certification]] (2024) 
- Qualys Vulnerability Management Certification (2024)

### ğŸ§­ What Iâ€™m Focusing on Next 
- Cloud Security (AWS & GCP) 
- Scripting for Security (Python, PowerShell) 
- Penetration Testing Methodologies

### ğŸ§° Tools Iâ€™ve Used 
- Qualys VM 
- IBM QRadar(SIEM) 
- CrowdStrike EDR

### ğŸ“š Certifications & Learning Resources 
**Certifications:**
- [[CompTIA Security+]] 
- [[Google Cybersecurity Certification]] 
- Qualys Vulnerability Management Certification
**Learning Resources** 
- [MITRE ATT&CK Framework](https://attack.mitre.org/) 
- [OWASP Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/) 
- [TryHackMe](https://tryhackme.com/) 
- [Hack The Box](https://www.hackthebox.com/) 
- [NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF)](https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework) 
- [PortSwigger Web Security Academy](https://portswigger.net/web-security) 

### ğŸ’¡ How to Get Started in Cybersecurity
 Hereâ€™s what worked for me:
 1. **Start with fundamentals.** Get cybersecurity-related certification (free certification (ex: [[Google Cybersecurity Certification]]), [[CompTIA Security+]]), it will give you a solid foundation.
 2. **Learn by doing.** [TryHackMe](https://tryhackme.com/) and [Hack The Box](https://www.hackthebox.com/) are amazing for hands-on practice. 
 3. **Work on projects.** Analyze sample incidents, write scripts to automate security tasks, or document mock risk assessments. 
 4. **Intern or volunteer.** Working on real projects (like I did at Toyota) gives perspective that labs canâ€™t.

### ğŸ’¡ ğŸš€ Final Thoughts
  Security isnâ€™t about achieving perfection â€” itâ€™s about staying ahead.
